summary.long: 2 Kings is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Moab rebelled against Israel after the death of Ahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahaziah had fallen through the lattice in his upper room, which was in Samaria, and he was injured. So he sent messengers, and he said to them, “Go, inquire of Baal-Zebub, the god of Ekron, if I will survive this injury.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of Yahweh spoke to Elijah the Tishbite, “Get up, go up to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria and speak to them, ‘Is it because there is no God in Israel that you are going to inquire of Baal-Zebub, the god of Ekron?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, thus says Yahweh, ‘The bed upon which you have gone, you will not come down from it, but you shall surely die.’” So Elijah went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the messengers returned to him, he asked them, “Why have you returned?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “A man came up to meet us, and he said to us, ‘Go, return to the king who sent you and speak to him, “Thus says Yahweh, ‘Is it because there is no God in Israel that you are sending to inquire of Baal-Zebub the god of Ekron? Therefore the bed upon which you have gone, you will not come down from it, for you will surely die.’”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he spoke to them, “What was the manner of the man who came up to meet you and spoke to you all these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered him, “A hairy man with a leather belt girded around his waist.” And he said, “It is Elijah the Tishbite.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ahaziah sent to him the commander of fifty with his fifty men, and he went up to him while he was sitting on the top of the hill. He said to him, “O man of God, the king says, ‘Come down.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah answered and said to the commander of the fifty, “If I am a man of God, let fire come down from heaven and consume you and your fifty!” Then fire came down from heaven and consumed him and his fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he again sent another commander of fifty and his fifty men. He answered and said to him, “O man of God, thus says the king, ‘Come down quickly!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah answered and said to them, “If I am a man of God, then let fire come down from heaven and consume you and your fifty!” Then the fire of God came down from heaven and consumed him and his fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he again sent a third time a commander of fifty and his fifty, and the commander of the third fifty went up and came and knelt down on his knees before Elijah and entreated him. He said to him, “O man of God, please let my life and the lives of your servants, these fifty, be precious in your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, fire from heaven came down and consumed the first two commanders of fifty and their fifties, so then let my life be precious in your eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of Yahweh spoke to Elijah, “Go down with him. Do not be afraid because of him.” So he got up and went down with him to the king,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to him, “Thus says Yahweh, ‘Because you have sent messengers to inquire of Baal-Zebub, the god of Ekron—is it because there is no God in Israel from whom to inquire his word?—therefore the bed upon which you went, you shall not come down from it, for you shall surely die.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he died, according to the word of Yahweh which Elijah had spoken, and Joram became king in his place in the second year of Joram the son of Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, because he had no son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The remainder of the acts of Ahaziah which he did, are they not written in the scroll of the events of the days of the kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yahweh was about to take Elijah up in the storm to heaven, Elijah and Elisha went from Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elijah said to Elisha, “Please stay here, for Yahweh has sent me up to Bethel.” Elisha said, “As Yahweh lives and as your soul lives, I will certainly not leave you!” So they went down to Bethel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sons of the prophets who were in Bethel came out to Elisha, and they said to him, “Do you know that Yahweh is going to take your master from you today?” He said, “I also know; be quiet!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elijah said to him, “Elisha, please stay here because Yahweh has sent me to Jericho.” And he said, “As Yahweh lives and as your soul lives, I will certainly not leave you!” So they came to Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sons of the prophets who were in Jericho came near to Elisha, and they said to him, “Do you know that Yahweh is going to take your master from you today?” He said, “I also know; be quiet!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah said to him, “Please stay here, because Yahweh has sent me to the Jordan.” He said, “As Yahweh lives and as your soul lives, I will certainly not leave you!” So the two of them went on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then fifty men from the sons of the prophets went and stood opposite them at a distance while the two of them stood by the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elijah took his cloak, rolled it up, and struck the water. It divided in two, and the two of them crossed over on dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they crossed over, Elijah said to Elisha, “Ask what I may do for you before I am taken away from you.” Then Elisha said, “Please let there come to me a double portion of your spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “What you ask is difficult. If you see me being taken from you, it will be so for you, but if not, it will not happen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they were walking, talking as they went. Suddenly a fiery chariot with horses of fire appeared and separated between the two of them. Elijah went up in the storm to the heavens
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while Elisha was watching and crying out, “My father, my father; the chariot of Israel and its horsemen!” But he could not see him any longer, and he grasped his clothes and tore them in two pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he picked up Elijah’s cloak that had fallen off of him, and he returned and stood on the bank of the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took Elijah’s cloak that had fallen from upon him and struck the water. Then he said, “Where is Yahweh, the God of Elijah?” So he also struck the water, and it divided in two, and Elisha crossed over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sons of the prophets who were at Jericho saw him from the other side, they declared, “The spirit of Elijah rests upon Elisha,” and they came to meet him and bowed down to him to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “Look, there are with your servants fifty able men. Please let them go and look for your master, lest the Spirit of Yahweh has lifted him up and thrown him on one of the mountains or into one of the valleys,” but he said, “You must not send them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they urged him until embarrassing him, so he said, “Send them.” So they sent fifty men, and they looked for three days, but they could not find him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they returned to him while he was staying in Jericho. He said to them, “Did I not tell you not to go?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of the city said to Elisha, “Please now, the location of the city is good, as my master can see, but the water is bad and the land unproductive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Bring me a new bowl and put salt in it.” So they brought it to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went out to the spring of waters and threw the salt into it there and said, “Thus says Yahweh, ‘I hereby purify these waters; let there be no longer any death or unproductiveness from it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the waters were purified until this very day according to the word of Elisha that he spoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went up from there to Bethel; as he was going up along the way, young boys came out from the city and mocked at him and said to him, “Go up, baldhead; go up, baldhead!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he turned around and saw them, he cursed them in the name of Yahweh. Then two bears came out of the forest and mauled forty-two boys among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went from there to Mount Carmel and from there he returned to Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joram the son of Ahab had become king over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah. He reigned twelve years
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did evil in the eyes of Yahweh, yet not as his father or his mother, as he removed the stone pillars of Baal that his father had made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he did cling to the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat who caused Israel to sin, and he did not depart from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Mesha king of Moab was a sheep breeder, and he used to deliver to the king of Israel a hundred thousand male lambs and a hundred thousand wool rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that when Ahab died, Mesha king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Joram went out on that day from Samaria, and he mustered all of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went and sent a message to Jehoshaphat king of Judah, saying, “The king of Moab has rebelled against me. Will you go with me against Moab for the battle?” And he said, “I will go up. I am like you; my people are like your people; my horses are like your horses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Which way shall we go up?” And he answered, “By way of the wilderness of Edom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king of Israel and the king of Judah and the king of Edom went around, a way of seven days, but there was no water for the army or for the animals which were with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Israel said, “Aha, Yahweh has called for these three kings to give them into the hand of Moab.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoshaphat asked, “Is there no prophet of Yahweh here that we might inquire guidance from Yahweh?” One of the servants of the king of Israel answered and said, “Elisha the son of Shaphat is here, who poured water on the hands of Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoshaphat said, “The word of Yahweh is with him.” So the king of Israel, Jehoshaphat, and the king of Edom went down to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elisha said to the king of Israel, “What do we have in common? Go to the prophets of your father and to the prophets of your mother.” Then the king of Israel said to him, “No, for Yahweh has called for these three kings to give them into the hand of Moab.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elisha said, “As Yahweh of hosts lives, before whom I stand, surely if I was not regarding the face of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, I would have not looked at you nor even glanced at you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, bring me a musician.” It happened that at the moment the musician played, the hand of Yahweh came upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Thus says Yahweh, ‘Make this wadi full of cisterns,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for thus says Yahweh, ‘You will see neither wind nor rain, yet this wadi will be full of water; and you and all of your livestock and your animals shall drink.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And since this is too trivial in the eyes of Yahweh, he will also give Moab into your hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall defeat every fortified city, every choice city, and you shall fell every good tree. All of the springs of water you shall stop up, and every tract of good land you shall ruin with the stones.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened in the morning about the time of the morning offering, that water was suddenly coming from the direction of Edom and the land was filled with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all of Moab had heard that the kings had come up to fight against them, and all who were fighting age and up were called up, and they stood at the border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arose early in the morning, the sun shone on the waters, and Moab saw the waters from the opposite side as red as blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “This is blood! Certainly the kings have fought one another, and each has killed his neighbor. Now, to the war booty, O Moab!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they came to the camp of Israel, Israel stood up and killed Moab, so that they fled from before them. They came at her and defeated Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities they tore down, on every good tract of land they threw stones until it was filled up, every spring of water they stopped up, and every good tree they felled. They let the stone walls at Kir Hareseth remain, but the slingers surrounded and attacked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the king of Moab saw that the battle was too heavy for him, he took with him seven hundred men who drew the sword to break through to the king of Edom, but they were not able.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took his firstborn son who was to become king in his place and offered him as a burnt offering on the wall. Great wrath came upon Israel, and they withdrew from him and returned to the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain woman from the wives of the sons of the prophets cried out to Elisha, saying, “Your servant my husband is dead. Now you know that your servant was a fearer of Yahweh, but the creditor came to take two of my children for himself as slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elisha asked her, “What shall I do for you? Tell me, what do you have in the house?” Then she said, “Your servant has nothing in the house except a jar of olive oil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to her, “Go, ask for yourself some containers from the streets, from all your neighbors. You must collect as many empty containers as you can!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also go and shut the door behind you and your children, and you must pour out oil into all of these containers and set the filled ones aside.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she went from him, and she shut the door behind her and her children. They were bringing containers to her, and she kept pouring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that when the containers were full, she said to her son, “Bring near me another container,” but he said to her, “There is not another container.” Then the olive oil stopped flowing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she came and told the man of God, and he said, “Go, sell the olive oil and repay your debt. You and your sons can live on what is left over.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened one day that Elisha passed through to Shunem where there was a wealthy woman, and she urged him to eat bread; so it happened each time he passed through, he would stop there to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to her husband, “Please now, I know that he is a holy man of God who is passing our way regularly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let us make a small enclosed room upstairs and put a bed, table, chair, and lampstand there for him, so that when he comes to us, he can turn and stay there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day it happened that he came there and went to the upper room and lay down there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to Gehazi his servant, “Call to this Shunammite,” so he called to her, and she stood before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Please say to her, ‘Look, you took all this trouble, showing care for us; what is there for me to do for you? To speak for you to the king or to the commander of the army?’” She said, “I am living among my people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “What may be done for her?” Gehazi said, “Well, she has no son, and her husband is old.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Call for her,” so he called for her and she stood in the doorway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “At this time next spring, you will be embracing a son.” She said, “No, my lord, O man of God! You must not tell a lie to your servant!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the woman conceived, and she bore a son in the spring, which Elisha had promised to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The child grew older, and it happened one day that he went out to his father and to the reapers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to his father, “My head, my head!” So he said to the servant, “Carry him to his mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they carried him and brought him to his mother; he sat on her lap until noon and then died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went up, laid him on the bed of the man of God, closed the door, and went out behind it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She called to her husband and said, “Please send one of the servants and one of the female donkeys for me, so that I can go quickly up to the man of God and return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Why are you going to him today? It is neither the new moon nor the Sabbath!” And she said, “Peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She saddled the female donkey, and she said to her servant, “Drive along and go; you must not hold me back from riding, unless I tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she went and came to the man of God by Mount Carmel. It happened when the man of God saw her at a distance, he said to Gehazi his servant, “There is this Shunammite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, please run to meet her and ask her, ‘Is it peace for you? Is it peace for your husband? Is it peace for the boy?’” She said, “Peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she came to the man of God at the mountain, and she caught hold of his feet. Then Gehazi came near to push her away, but the man of God said, “Let her alone, for her soul is bitter, and Yahweh has hidden it from me and has not told me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she said, “Did I ask for a son from my lord? Did I not say that you must not mislead me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to Gehazi, “Gird up your loins and take my staff in your hand and go. If you meet anyone, you must not greet them; if anyone greets you, you must not answer them. You must put my staff on the face of the boy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the mother of the boy said, “As Yahweh lives and as your soul lives, I will surely not leave you.” So he got up and went after her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gehazi crossed over before them, and he put the staff on the face of the boy; but there was no sound, and there was no sign of life, so he returned to meet him. He told him, saying, “The boy did not wake up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Elisha came to the house, here was the boy dead, lying on his bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went and closed the door behind the two of them and prayed to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went up and lay upon the child and put his mouth on his mouth, his eyes on his eyes, and his palms on his palms. As he bent down over him, the flesh of the boy became warm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He returned and went to and fro in the house one time, then he went up and bent over him. Then the boy sneezed seven times and opened his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elisha called to Gehazi and said, “Call this Shunammite.” So he called her and she came to him; then he said, “Pick up your son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She came and fell at his feet and bowed down to the ground; then she picked up her son and went out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Elisha returned to Gilgal. Now the famine was in the land, and the sons of the prophets were sitting before him. He said to his servant, put on the large pot and cook a stew for the sons of the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One went out to the field to gather herbs, and he found a wild vine and gathered wild gourds from it and filled his cloak. Then he came and cut them into the pot of stew, but they did not know what they were.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They served the men to eat, but when they ate from the stew, they cried out and said, “There is death in the pot, O man of God!” They were not able to eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Bring some flour,” and he threw it into the pot. He then said, “Serve the people and let them eat.” There was nothing harmful in the pot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man came from Baal-Shalishah and brought food to the man of God: firstfruits and twenty loaves of barley bread, with ripe grain in his sack. He said, “Give it to the people and let them eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his servant said, “How can I set this before a hundred men?” He said, “Give it to the people and let them eat, for thus Yahweh says, ‘They shall eat and have some left over.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he set it before them, and they ate and had some left over, according to the word of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Naaman was the commander of the army of the king of Aram. He was a great man before his master and highly regarded, for by him Yahweh had given victory to Aram. Now the man was a mighty warrior, but he was afflicted with a skin disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Arameans went on a raid, they brought back a young girl from the land of Israel, and she came into the service of the wife of Naaman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to her mistress, “If only my lord would come before the prophet who is in Samaria; then he would cure his skin disease.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came and told his master, saying, “Thus and so the girl who is from the land of Israel said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king of Aram said, “Go, I will send a letter to the king of Israel.” He went and took with him ten talents of silver, six thousand shekels of gold, and ten sets of clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he brought the letter of the king to Israel, saying, “Now, when this letter comes to you, I have just sent Naaman my servant to you that you may cure him from his skin disease.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that when the king of Israel read the letter, he tore his clothes and said, “Am I God to cause death or to give life? This man is sending a man to me to cure his disease. Indeed! But know and see that he seeks an opportunity against me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that as soon as Elisha the man of God heard that the king of Israel had torn his clothes, he sent to the king, saying, “Why did you tear your clothes? Please may he come to me, that he might know that there is a prophet in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Naaman came with his horses and his chariots, and he stopped at the doorway of the house of Elisha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elisha sent a messenger to him, saying, “Go, you must wash seven times in the Jordan, then your flesh shall return to you, and you shall be clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Naaman became angry and he went and said, “Look, I said to myself, ‘Surely he will come out, stand, call upon the name of Yahweh his God, and wave his hands over the spot; then he would take away the skin disease.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are not the Abana and the Pharpar, the rivers of Damascus, better than all of the waters of Israel? Could I not wash in them that I may be clean?” Then he turned and left in anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his servants came near and spoke to him and said, “My father, if the prophet had spoken a difficult thing to you to do, would you not have done it? Why not even when he says to you, ‘Wash and you shall be clean’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went down and plunged into the Jordan seven times, according to the word of the man of God, and his flesh returned as the flesh of a small boy, and he was clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he returned to the man of God, he and all of his army, he came and stood before him and said, “Please now, I know that there is no God in all of the world except in Israel. So then, please take a gift from your servant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “As Yahweh lives, before whom I stand, I surely will not take it.” Still he urged him to take it, but he refused.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Naaman said, “If not, then please let a load of soil on a pair of mules be given to your servants, for your servant will never again bring a burnt offering and sacrifice to other gods, but only to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As far as this matter, may Yahweh pardon your servant when my master goes into the house of Rimmon to worship there, and he is leaning himself on my arm, that I also bow down in the house of Rimmon: when I bow down in the house of Rimmon, may Yahweh please pardon your servant in this matter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Go in peace,” so he went from him a short distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Gehazi the servant of Elisha, the man of God, thought, “Look, my master has refrained from taking what this Aramean Naaman brought from his hand. As Yahweh lives, I will certainly run after him, and I will accept something from him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gehazi pursued after Naaman. When Naaman saw someone running after him, he jumped off his chariot to meet him and asked him, “Is it peace?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Peace. My master has sent me saying, ‘Look, just now two servants from the hill country of Ephraim came to me, from the sons of the prophets. Please give them a talent of silver and two sets of clothing.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Naaman said, “Be prepared to accept two talents.” So he urged him and tied up two talents of silver in two bags, with two sets of clothing and gave it to two of his servants and they carried it before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came to the citadel, he took them from their hand and put them in the house, then sent away the men so that they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he went and stood by his master, Elisha asked him, “From where have you come, Gehazi?” And he said, “Your servant has not gone anywhere.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to him, “Did not my heart go with you as the man turned from on his chariot to meet you? Is it time to take silver, clothes, olive orchards, vineyards, sheep, oxen, male slaves, and female slaves?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The skin disease of Naaman shall cling to you and to your offspring forever.” Then he went out from before him having a skin disease like the snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sons of the prophets said to Elisha, “Please look; the place where we are living before you is too cramped for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us please go to the Jordan and each bring from there one log that we might make a place there for us to live.” Then he said, “Do so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a certain one said, “Please be prepared and go with your servants,” and he said, “I will go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went with them, and they went to the Jordan, and they cut down the trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened as the one was felling the log, that the iron ax fell into the water. He called out and said, “Oh, no! My master, it was borrowed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man of God said, “Where did it fall?” So he showed him the place, and then he cut off a stick and threw it there and made the iron ax float.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Pick it up for yourself,” so he stretched out his hand and took it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Aram was fighting with Israel, so he consulted with his officers, saying, “My camp is at such and such a place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man of God sent to the king of Israel, saying, “Take care while crossing over to this place, because the Arameans are descending there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king of Israel sent to the place which the man of God said to him and warned him, so he was on guard there continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the heart of the king of Aram was stormy because of this matter, so he called his servants and said to them, “Can you not tell me who among us sides with the king of Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of his servants said, “No, my lord the king, but Elisha the prophet who is in Israel tells the king of Israel things which you speak in your own bedchamber.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Go and see where he is so that I can send and capture him.” Then he was told to him, “Look, he is in Dothan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sent horses, chariots, and an oppressing army there. They arrived at night and surrounded the town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The attendant of the man of God arose early and went out, and look, the army was surrounding the city with horses and chariots. His servant said to him, “Oh no, my master! What shall we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Don’t be afraid, for more are with us than are with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elisha prayed and said, “O Yahweh, please open his eyes that he may see,” and Yahweh opened the eyes of the servant, and he saw, and look, the mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire all around Elisha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came down to him, and Elisha prayed to Yahweh and said, “Please strike this people with blindness,” so he struck them with blindness as Elisha had spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elisha said to them, “This is not the way and this is not the city. Come after me, and I will bring you to the man whom you seek.” Then he brought them to Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened at the moment they came to Samaria, Elisha said, “O Yahweh, open the eyes of these that they may see,” so Yahweh opened their eyes, and they saw, and look, the middle of Samaria!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Israel said to Elisha when he saw them, “Shall I kill them? Shall I kill, my father?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “You shall not kill. Would you kill those whom you took captive with the sword or with the bow? Put food and water before them that they may eat and drink and then go to their master.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he made a great feast for them, and they ate and drank; then he sent them, and they went to their master. And the bands of the Arameans did not come again into the land of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened after this that Ben-Hadad king of Aram assembled all of his army and marched up and laid siege against Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a great famine in Samaria, and behold, a siege was against it, until the head of a donkey went for eighty shekels of silver, and one fourth of the measure of the dung of doves went for five shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that the king of Israel was crossing over on the wall, and a woman called out to him, saying, “Help, my lord the king!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “No, let Yahweh help you. How can I save you? From the threshing floor or from the wine press?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king said to her, “What is the problem?” Then the woman said, “This woman said to me, ‘Give me your son, and let us eat him today, then tomorrow we will eat my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we cooked my son and ate him, and I said to her the next day, ‘Give your son that we may eat him.’ But she had hidden her son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that when the king heard the words of the woman, he tore his clothes. Now he had been walking on the wall, and the people saw, and behold, sackcloth was over his flesh underneath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “May God do to me and thus may he add, if the head of Elisha the son of Shaphat remains on him today!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elisha was sitting in his house and the elders were sitting with him, and the king dispatched a man from before him, but before the messenger came to him, he said to the elders, “Did you see that this son of a murderer has sent to remove my head? Look, when the messenger comes, close the door; and you must hold the door closed against him. Is not the sound of the feet of his master behind him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking with them, suddenly the messenger was coming down to him, and he said, “Look this trouble is from Yahweh. Why should I wait for Yahweh any longer?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elisha said, “Hear the word of Yahweh: ‘Thus says Yahweh, “At this time tomorrow a seah of wheat bread flour will sell for a shekel, and two seahs of barley for a shekel in the gate of Samaria.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officer on whom the king relied answered the man of God and said, “Look, even if Yahweh is making windows in heaven, could this thing happen?” And he said, “Look, you will be seeing it with your eyes, but you shall not eat from it there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now four men who had a skin disease were at the entrance of the gate, and they said to each other, “Why are we sitting here until we die?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we say, ‘Let us go into the city,’ the famine is in the city, and we shall die there; but if we sit here, we shall die. So then, come, let us fall into the camp of the Arameans. If they let us live, we shall live; but if they kill us, then we shall die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they got up at dusk to go to the camp of the Arameans. They went up to the edge of the camp of the Arameans, and look, there was no man there!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord had caused the camp of the Arameans to hear the sound of chariots, the sound of horses, and the sound of a great army. So they said to one another, “Look, the king of Israel has hired the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Egypt to come against us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they got up and fled at dusk and left their tents, their horses, their donkeys, and the camp as it was, and they fled for their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When these who had the skin disease came to the edge of the camp, they went into a certain tent and they ate, drank, and took from there silver and gold and clothes. Then they went and hid them, then returned and came to another tent, and they took from there and went and hid them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to one another, “We are not doing right. This day is a day of good news! If we are silent and wait until the light of morning, they will find us and we will be punished. So then, come, let us go and tell the house of the king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came, they called to the gatekeepers of the city and told them, saying, “We came to the camp of the Arameans, and behold, there was no man or the voice of a man there! Only the horses and the donkeys were tied up, and the tents were left as they were.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the gatekeepers called and told it inside the house of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king got up in the night and said to his servants, “Please let me tell you what the Arameans have done to us. The Arameans know that we are hungry, so they went out from the camp to hide in the field, saying, ‘When they go out from the city, we shall seize them alive and go into the city.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of his servants replied and said, “Please let them take five of the remaining horses which remain in the city; behold, they are like all of the multitude of Israel that remain in it; they are like all the multitude of Israel who have perished. Let us send and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he took two charioteer horsemen, and the king sent after the camp of the Arameans, saying, “Go, find out,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they went after them to the Jordan. Look, all of the way was littered with clothes and equipment which the Arameans had thrown away in their haste. Then the messengers returned and told the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people went out and plundered the camp of the Arameans. A seah of wheat flour went for a shekel and two seahs of barley went for a shekel according to the word of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king appointed the officer he was depending on over the gate, but the people trampled him and he died, according to that which the man of God had said which he spoke when the king came down to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened as the man of God spoke to the king, saying, “Two seahs of barley shall be sold for a shekel and a seah of wheat flour for a shekel at this time tomorrow in the gate of Samaria.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officer had replied to the man of God and said, “Look, even if Yahweh is opening the windows in heaven, could this thing happen?” And he had said, “Look you are about to see it with your eyes, but you will not eat from it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it had happened to him; the people trampled him in the gate and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elisha spoke to the woman whose son he had restored to life, saying, “Get up and go, you and your household, and dwell as an alien wherever you can, for Yahweh has called for a famine, and it will come to the land for seven years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the woman got up and did according to the word of the man of God. She and her household went and dwelt as an alien in the land of the Philistines for seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened at the end of seven years that the woman returned from the land of the Philistines and went out to appeal to the king for her household and for her properties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the king was speaking to Gehazi the servant of the man of God, saying, “Please tell me all of the great things which Elisha has done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that as he was telling the king how he had restored the dead to life, suddenly the woman whose son he had restored to life was crying out to the king about her household and about her field. Then Gehazi said, “My lord the king, this is the woman and this is her son whom Elisha restored to life!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king asked the woman, and she told him. So the king appointed for her a certain court official, saying, “Restore all that is hers and all the yield of the field from the day she left the land up to now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elisha came to Damascus. Now Ben-Hadad king of Aram was ill, and he was told, “The man of God has come up here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said to Hazael, “Take a gift in your hand and go meet the man of God. Inquire of Yahweh from him, saying, ‘Shall I recover from this illness?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hazael went to meet him and took a gift in his hand of all of the good things of Damascus, a load on each of forty camels, and he came and stood before him. Then he said, “Your son Ben-Hadad king of Aram has sent me to you, saying, ‘Shall I recover from this illness?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elisha said to him, “Go; say to him, ‘You shall certainly recover,’ but Yahweh has shown me that he certainly will die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man fixed his gaze and stared at him until he was ashamed and the man of God cried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hazael asked, “Why is my lord crying?” He said, “Because I know what evil you will do to the Israelites. You will set their fortifications on fire, and you will kill their young men with the sword. Their little ones you will dash to pieces, and their pregnant women you will rip open!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hazael said, “But how could your servant, who is like a dog, do this great thing?” Elisha said, “Yahweh has shown me that you are to be king over Aram.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he departed from Elisha and came to his master. He asked him, “What did Elisha say to you.” So he said, “He said to me that you will certainly recover.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, he took the bed cover, dipped it in the water, and spread it over his face so that he died. Then Hazael became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the fifth year of Joram son of Ahab, king of Israel, and Jehoshaphat king of Judah, Joram son of Jehoshaphat became the king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He walked in the way of the kings of Israel as the house of Ahab had done, for the daughter of Ahab became his wife, and he did evil in the eyes of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet Yahweh was not willing to destroy Judah, for the sake of David his servant, as he had promised to give him a lamp for his sons always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his days, Edom rebelled against the rule of Judah, and they set up a king over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joram crossed over to Zair and all the chariots with him. It happened that he arose by night and attacked Edom who had surrounded him and the commanders of the chariots; but the army fled to their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Edom has rebelled against the rule of Judah until this day; then Libnah also rebelled at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The remainder of the acts of Joram and all that he did, are they not written in the scroll of the events of the days of the kings of Judah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joram slept with his ancestors, and he was buried with his ancestors in the city of David, and Ahaziah his son became king in place of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twelfth year of Joram the son of Ahab, king of Israel, Ahaziah the son of Joram became king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahaziah was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned one year in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Athaliah daughter of Omri, king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He walked in the way of the house of Ahab and did evil in the eyes of Yahweh, as the house of Ahab; for he was the son-in-law of the house of Ahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went with Joram the son of Ahab for the battle against Hazael king of Aram at Ramoth-Gilead, and the Arameans wounded Joram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joram the king returned to Jezreel to heal from the wounds which the Arameans had inflicted at Ramah when Hazael king of Aram fought him. Ahaziah the son of Joram, king of Judah, went down to see Joram the son of Ahab in Jezreel, for he was ill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elisha the prophet called for one of the sons of the prophets, and he said to him, “Gird your loins, and take this flask of olive oil in your hand, and go to Ramoth-Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go there and look there for Jehu the son of Jehoshaphat the son of Nimshi. Go, for you must cause him to arise from among his brothers, and you must bring him into an inner room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must take the flask of olive oil and pour it out on his head. You must say, ‘Thus says Yahweh, “I hereby anoint you as king over Israel.”’ Then you must open the door and flee; do not linger!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the young man, servant of the prophet, went to Ramoth-Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came, and look, the commanders of the army were sitting there. He said, “I have a word for you, O commander!” Jehu said, “For whom? For all of us?” And he said, “For you, O commander!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He got up and went to the house, and poured the olive oil on his head and said to him, “Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: ‘I hereby anoint you as king over the people of Yahweh, over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will destroy the house of Ahab your master, and you will avenge the blood of my servants the prophets and the blood of all of the servants of Yahweh, from the hand of Jezebel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of the house of Ahab will perish, and I shall cut off all males from Ahab, both bond and free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make the house of Ahab like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat and like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The dogs will eat Jezebel in the territory of Jezreel, and there shall not be anyone to bury her.’” Then he opened the door and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehu came out to the officers of his master, and they said to him, “Peace? Why did this madman come to you?” And he said to them, “You know the man and his foolish talk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Liar. Please tell us.” He said, “Thus and so he said to me, saying, ‘Thus says Yahweh, “I hereby anoint you as king over Israel.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they hastened each one to take his cloak, and they spread them under him on the bare steps, blew on the trumpet, and said, “Jehu is king!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jehu the son of Jehoshaphat the son of Nimshi conspired against Joram. Now Joram was keeping guard in Ramoth-Gilead, he and all of Israel, because of the threat of Hazael king of Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joram the king had returned to heal in Jezreel from the wound which the Arameans had inflicted on him when he fought with Hazael king of Aram. Jehu said, “If this is what you want, do not let him go out as a fugitive from the city to go to make it known in Jezreel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehu mounted his chariot and went to Jezreel, for Joram was lying there, and Ahaziah king of Judah had gone down to visit Joram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the watchman was standing on the tower in Jezreel, and he saw the company of Jehu when he came, and he said, “I see a company.” Joram said, “Take a horseman and send him to meet them.” And he said, “Is it peace?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the rider of the horse went out to meet him, and he said, “Thus the king asks, ‘Is it peace?’” Then Jehu said, “What do you have to do with peace? Turn after me.” Then the watchman reported, saying, “The messenger went up to them, but he did not return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent out a second horseman, and he came to them and said, “Thus the king asks, ‘Is it peace?’” Then Jehu said, “What do you have to do with peace? Turn after me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the sentinel reported, saying, “He went up to them, but he did not return, and the driving is like the driving of Jehu the son of Nimshi, for he drives with madness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joram said, “Get ready,” so he got his chariot ready. Joram king of Israel went out, and Ahaziah king of Judah, each with his chariot. They went out to meet Jehu, and they found him at the tract of land of Naboth the Jezreelite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joram saw Jehu, he asked, “Is it peace?” And he said, “What peace is there while the prostitutions of your mother Jezebel and her sorceries are numerous?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joram turned his chariot and fled and said to Ahaziah, “It’s treason, Ahaziah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehu drew his bow and shot Joram between his shoulders so that the arrow went out from his heart, and he slumped down in his chariot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to Bidkar his third servant, “Lift him out and throw him on the plot of the field of Naboth the Jezreelite, for remember, you and I were with the pair of chariots behind Ahab his father when Yahweh pronounced this oracle against him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“Since I saw the blood of Naboth and the blood of his children yesterday,” declares Yahweh, “I will requite it for you in this tract of land,” declares Yahweh.’ So then lift him out and throw him on the tract of land according to the word of Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Ahaziah king of Judah saw, he fled the way of Beth-Haggen. Jehu pursued after him and said, “Shoot him also, in the chariot.” They shot him at the ascent of Gur which is in Ibleam, and he fled to Megiddo, but he died there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his officers carried him to Jerusalem, and they buried him in his tomb with his ancestors in the city of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year of Joram the son of Ahab, Ahaziah had become king over Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jehu came to Jezreel, Jezebel heard of it, so she painted her eyes with black eye paint and adorned her head and looked through the window.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jehu had come in the gate, so she said, “Is it peace, O Zimri, murderer of his master?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he lifted up his face to the window, he asked, “Who is with me?” Two or three eunuchs looked down to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Throw her down.” So they threw her down, and her blood spattered on the wall and on the horses, and they trampled her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came and ate and drank, and said, “Please take care of this cursed one and bury her, for she is the daughter of a king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they went to bury her, they could not find her, except the skull, the feet, and the palms of the hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They returned and told him, and he said, “This is the word of Yahweh which he spoke by the hand of his servant Elijah the Tishbite, saying, ‘On the plot of ground of Jezreel, the dogs shall eat the flesh of Jezebel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the dead body of Jezebel became dung on the surface spread on the field in the plot of ground of Jezreel, so one cannot say, “This is Jezebel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria, and Jehu wrote letters, and he sent them to Samaria to the officials of Jezreel, to the elders and to the guardians of Ahab, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, when this letter comes to you and your master’s sons are with you, the chariots are with you, the horses, a fortified city, and weapons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you must select the best and the most suitable from the sons of your master, and you must place him on the throne of his father, and they must fight for the house of your masters.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were very afraid, and they said, “Look, two kings could not stand before him; how can we stand?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So whoever was over the house, and whoever was over the city, and the elders and the guardians sent to Jehu, saying, “We are your servants; all that you say to us, we shall do. We shall not make anyone a king. Do what is good in your eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he wrote to them a second letter, saying, “If you are for me, and you are listening to my voice, take the heads of the men of the sons of your master and come to me at this time tomorrow at Jezreel.” Now the sons of the king, seventy men, were with the leaders of the city who were raising them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the letter came to them, they took the sons of the king, and they killed seventy men. Then they put their heads in baskets and sent them to him at Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the messenger came and told him, saying, “They have brought the heads of the king’s sons,” and he said, “Put them in two piles at the entrance of the gate until morning.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened in the morning that he went out, stood, and said to all of the people, “You are righteous. Look, I conspired against my master and killed him. But who killed all of these?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know then that the word of Yahweh will not fail which Yahweh spoke concerning the house of Ahab; Yahweh has done what he spoke by the hand of his servant Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehu killed all of the remainder of the house of Ahab in Jezreel, all of his leaders, his close friends, and his priests, until there was no survivor left for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he arose and went and came to Samaria. On the way, he was at Beth-Eked of the shepherds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehu met the brothers of Ahaziah king of Judah. He asked, “Who are you?” They said, “We are the brothers of Ahaziah; we came down for the peace of the king’s children and the children of the queen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Seize them alive!” So they seized them alive but then slaughtered them at the cistern of Beth-Eked, forty-two men. He did not allow any of them to survive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next he went from there and found Jehonadab the son of Recab to meet him. He greeted him and asked him, “Is your heart right with me as my heart is with you?” Then Jehonadab said, “Yes, it is. Give your hand!” And he gave his hand and took him up to him on the chariot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Come with me! Look at my zeal for Yahweh!” So he let him ride in his chariot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to Samaria and killed all who remained to Ahab in Samaria until he wiped them out according to the word of Yahweh which he had spoken to Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehu assembled all of the people and said to them, “Ahab served Baal a little, but Jehu will worship him greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, summon to me all of the prophets of Baal and all of his servants and his priests; no man should fail to come, for I have a great sacrifice for Baal. Anyone who fails to come shall not live!” Now Jehu was acting with cunning in order to destroy the servants of Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehu said, “Sanctify a solemn assembly for Baal!” So they proclaimed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehu sent word through all of Israel, and all of the servants of Baal came; there did not remain a man who did not come. They came to the house of Baal so that the house of Baal was filled from wall to wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the one who was over the wardrobe, “Bring out clothing for all of the servants of Baal.” So he brought the clothing out for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehu and Jehonadab the son of Recab came to the temple of Baal, and he said to the servants of Baal, “Search and see that there is none of the servants of Yahweh here with you; only those who serve Baal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings. Now Jehu had stationed for himself eighty men outside, and he said, “The man who lets anyone escape from the men who I am entrusting to you, he will pay with his life!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that when he finished offering the burnt offering, Jehu said to the royal guard and to the officers, “Come and kill them; let no man go free!” So they put them to the sword, and the royal guard and the officers threw them out, then they went up to the citadel of the temple of Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought out the stone pillars of the temple of Baal and burned them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they broke down the stone pillars of Baal and destroyed the temple of Baal and made it into a latrine until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jehu wiped out Baal from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only Jehu did not turn aside from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat by which he caused Israel to sin; namely, the calf-shaped idols of gold which were in Bethel and Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Jehu, “Because you have done well by doing right in my eyes and you have done to the house of Ahab according to all that was in my heart; therefore, sons of the fourth generation will sit for you on the throne of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jehu was not careful to walk in the law of Yahweh God of Israel with all his heart; he did not turn from the sins of Jeroboam by which he caused Israel to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, Yahweh began to reduce Israel, so Hazael defeated them in every territory of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the Jordan eastward: all of the land of Gilead, the Gadites, the Reubenites, and the Manassites, from Aroer which is on the Wadi Arnon and Gilead and Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the remainder of the acts of Jehu and all that he did and all of his powerful deeds, are they not written in the scroll of the events of the days of the kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jehu slept with his ancestors, and they buried him in Samaria, and Jehoahaz his son became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the days which Jehu had reigned over Israel were twenty-eight years in Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, so she prepared to destroy all of the offspring of the royal family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jehosheba the daughter of King Joram and sister of Ahaziah took Jehoash the son of Ahaziah, and she stole him from among the sons of the king who were being put to death, putting him and his nurse in the inner bedroom. So they hid him from the presence of Athaliah, and he was not killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He remained with her in the temple of Yahweh, hidden for six years while Athaliah was reigning over the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the seventh year Jehoiada sent and took the commanders of the hundreds of the Carites and the runners, and he brought them to himself to the temple of Yahweh. Then he made a covenant with them and made them swear in the house of Yahweh and showed them the son of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded them, saying, “This is the thing which you must do: one third of you who go off duty on the Sabbath, the keepers of the guard in the house of the king,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and another third at the gate of Sur, and a third at the gate behind the runners, shall guard the post of the palace alternately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two of the units among you, all who go on duty on the Sabbath, guard the post of the temple of Yahweh for the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must surround the king all about, each with his weapon in his hand; whoever comes to the ranks must be killed. Be with the king wherever he goes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the commanders of hundreds did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded, and each took his men who went off duty on the Sabbath and those who came on duty on the Sabbath, and they came to Jehoiada the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest gave to the commanders of the hundreds spears and small round shields which were King David’s, which were in the temple of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the royal runners stood, each with his weapons in his hand, from the side of the temple to the south up to the side of the temple on the north, around the altar and around the temple, about the king all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought out the son of the king, put the crown on him with the testimony, and they made him king, anointed him, clapped their hands, and said, “Long live the king!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Athaliah heard the sound of the runners of the people, she came to the people at the temple of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She looked, and there was the king standing by the pillar according to the custom. The commanders and the trumpeters were by the king, and all of the people of the land were rejoicing and blowing on the trumpets. Athaliah tore her clothes and she called, “Treason, treason!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoiada the priest commanded the commanders of the hundreds, the appointed of the army, and he said to them, “Bring her out to the house of the ranks! The one coming after her should kill her with the sword,” for the priest had said, “Let her not be killed in the temple of Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they grabbed her as she went by the entranceway of the horses to the palace of the king, and she was killed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoiada made a covenant between Yahweh and the king and the people, that the people should be as a people for Yahweh, and also a covenant between the king and the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people of the land went to the temple of Baal and tore it down, and its altars and its images they broke completely into pieces. Mattan the priest of Baal they killed in front of the altars. Then the priest put guards over the house of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the commanders of the hundreds and the Carites and the runners and all the people of the land, and they brought the king down from the temple of Yahweh. And they marched by the way of the runner’s gate to the palace of the king, and he sat on the throne of the kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people of the land rejoiced, and the city rested; for Athaliah had been killed with the sword in the palace of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoash was seven years old when he began to reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the seventh year of Jehu, Jehoash became king. He reigned in Jerusalem forty years, and the name of his mother was Zibiah from Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoash did right in the eyes of Yahweh all of his days, because Jehoiada the priest instructed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the high places were not removed; the people were still making sacrifices and offering incense on the high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoash said to the priests, “All of the money for the sacred things that is brought to the temple of Yahweh, the money taxed at its proper value for each person and all of the money which comes upon the heart of a man to bring to the temple of Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let the priests take for themselves, each from his treasurers, and let them repair the breach of the temple for every place where damage is found.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened in the twenty-third year of King Jehoash that the priests had not repaired the damage in the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Jehoash summoned Jehoiada the priest and the priests, and he said to them, “Why are you not repairing the damage in the temple? Now, you shall not take money from your treasurers for the damage in the temple. You must provide it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the priests agreed not to take money from the people and not to repair the damage to the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoiada the priest took a certain chest and bored a hole in its lid, and he put it beside the altar to the right as a man enters into the temple of Yahweh; then the priests who were keepers of the threshold would put there all of the money brought into the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that when they saw a great deal of money in the chest, the secretary of the king and the high priest would come up, put the money in bags, then count the money found in the temple of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They placed the money, which was weighed out, into the hands of the workers who were appointed over the temple of Yahweh, and they paid it to the skilled craftsmen of wood and to the builders working on the temple of Yahweh
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to the masons and the stonecutters, to buy timber and stones for hewing, in order to repair the damage of the temple of Yahweh, and for all who went to the temple to repair it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only, for the temple of Yahweh, there were not any silver basins, snuffers, bowls for drinking wine, trumpets, or any vessel of gold or silver from the money being brought to the temple of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they gave that to all the workers, and they repaired the temple of Yahweh with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not have to settle accounts with the men into whose hands they placed the money to give to the workers, for they were dealing honestly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The money of the guilt offering and the money of the sin offering was not brought into the temple of Yahweh, but were each for the priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, Hazael king of Aram went up and fought against Gath and captured it; then Hazael set his face to go up against Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoash king of Judah took all of the holy objects that Jehoshaphat, Joram, and Ahaziah his ancestors, the kings of Judah, had devoted, and all his holy objects and all of the gold found in the treasuries of the temple of Yahweh, and in the palace of the king, and he sent them to Hazael king of Aram, so that he went up from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the remainder of the acts of Joash and all that he did, are they not written in the scroll of the events of the days of the kings of Judah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his servants arose and conspired and killed Joash in the house of the Millo as he was going down toward Silla.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jozabad the son of Shimeath and Jehozabad the son of Shomer, his servants, struck him and killed him, so they buried him with his ancestors in the city of David. Then Amaziah his son became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twenty-third year of Joash the son of Ahaziah, king of Judah, Jehoahaz the son of Jehu became king over Israel in Samaria, reigning seventeen years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he did evil in the eyes of Yahweh, and he went after the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat with which he had caused Israel to sin, and he did not depart from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the anger of Yahweh was kindled against Israel, and he gave them into the hand of Hazael king of Aram and into the hand of Ben-Hadad the son of Hazael repeatedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoahaz entreated Yahweh, and Yahweh listened to him, for he saw the oppression of Israel, because the king of Aram oppressed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh gave Israel a savior, and they went out from under the hand of Aram. So the Israelites lived in their tents as formerly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not depart from the sins of the house of Jeroboam which he caused Israel to sin, but walked in it; and also, the pole of the Asherah worship was still standing in Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there was no army left over for Jehoahaz except for fifty horsemen, ten chariots, and ten thousand infantry, for the king of Aram had destroyed them and made them as the dust at threshing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the remainder of the acts of Jehoahaz and all that he did and his powerful deeds, are they not written in the scroll of the events of the days of the kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoahaz slept with his ancestors and they buried him in Samaria, and Jehoash his son became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the thirty-seventh year of Joash king of Judah, Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz became king over Israel in Samaria, reigning sixteen years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did evil in the eyes of Yahweh; he did not depart from all of the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat which he caused Israel to sin, but walked in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The remainder of the acts of Joash and all that he did, his powerful deeds, and how he fought with Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the scroll of the events of the days of the kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joash slept with his ancestors, and Jeroboam sat on his throne. Joash was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elisha became ill with the illness with which he would die, so Jehoash king of Israel went down to him and wept before him, and said, “My father, my father; the chariot of Israel and its horsemen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elisha said to him, “Take a bow and arrows,” so he took him a bow and arrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the king of Israel, “Lay your hand on the bow,” so he lay hold of it; then Elisha put his hand on the hands of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Open the window to the east,” so he opened it. Elisha said, “Shoot,” and he shot. Then he said, “An arrow of victory for Yahweh, and an arrow of victory against Aram; you shall fight the Arameans in Aphek until finishing them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Take the arrows,” so he took them. He said to the king of Israel, “Strike the ground,” so he struck three times and stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the man of God became angry against him and said, “For striking five or six times, then you would have defeated Aram until finishing them, but now you will defeat Aram only three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elisha died and they buried him. Now the raiding parties of Moab came in the spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that they were burying a man; suddenly they saw the marauding band, so they threw the man in the grave of Elisha. As he went in, the man touched the bones of Elisha, and became alive and got up on his feet!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazael king of Aram oppressed Israel all the days of Jehoahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yahweh had mercy on them and showed compassion to them and turned to them because of his covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. He was not willing to destroy them nor cast them from his presence up to now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Hazael king of Aram died, his son Ben-Hadad became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz returned and took the cities from the hand of Ben-Hadad the son of Hazael which he had taken from the hand of Jehoahaz his father in the war. Three times Jehoash defeated him and recovered the towns of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the second year of Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz king of Israel, Amaziah the son of Jehoash king of Judah began to reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem; and the name of his mother was Jehoaddin from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did right in the eyes of Yahweh, only not as David his ancestor; as all which Jehoash his father had done, he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the high places were not removed; the people were still sacrificing and offering incense on the high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened that when the kingdom was firmly in his hand, he killed his servants who had killed his father the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the sons of the killers he did not kill, as it is written in the scroll of the law of Moses which Yahweh had commanded, saying, “Fathers should not be killed because of children, and children should not be killed because of fathers; but a man should die because of his own sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also killed ten thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt, and he seized Sela in the battle, and he called its name Jokteel, until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Amaziah sent messengers to Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz the son of Jehu king of Israel, saying, “Come let us meet face-to-face.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jehoash the king of Israel sent to Amaziah, saying, “The thornbush which is in Lebanon sent to the cedar which is in Lebanon, saying, ‘Give your daughter to my son as wife,’ but an animal of the field which is in Lebanon passed by and trampled the thornbush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have indeed defeated Edom and your heart is lifted up; enjoy the honor and stay home. Why should you provoke trouble so that you fall and Judah with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Amaziah would not listen, so Jehoash king of Israel went up and they met face-to-face, he and Amaziah king of Judah, at Beth-Shemesh which belongs to Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah was defeated before Israel and they fled, each to this tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoash king of Israel captured Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Jehoash, the son of Ahaziah, at Beth-Shemesh. Then they came to Jerusalem, and he broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the Gate of Ephraim up to the Corner Gate, four hundred cubits!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also took all of the gold and silver and all the vessels found in the temple of Yahweh and in the treasury rooms of the palace of the king, as well as the hostages; then he returned to Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the remainder of the acts of Jehoash which he did, and his powerful deeds, and how he fought with Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written on the scroll of the events of the days of the kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoash slept with his ancestors and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel, and Jeroboam his son reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amaziah the son of Jehoash king of Judah lived fifteen years after the death of Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The remainder of the acts of Amaziah, are they not written on the scroll of the events of the days of the kings of Judah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They conspired against him in Jerusalem, so he fled to Lachish. But they sent men after him to Lachish, and they killed him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they carried him on the horses, and he was buried with his ancestors in the city of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of the people of Judah took sixteen-year-old Azariah and made him king in place of this father Amaziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He rebuilt Elath and restored it to Judah after the king slept with his ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fifteenth year of Amaziah the son of Jehoash king of Judah, Jeroboam the son of Jehoash king of Israel began to reign in Samaria, reigning forty-one years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he did evil in the eyes of Yahweh; he did not depart from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat which he caused Israel to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He restored the boundary of Israel from Lebo-Hamath up to the sea of the Arabah, according to the word of Yahweh which he spoke by the hand of his servant Jonah the son of Amittai the prophet, who was from Gath-Hepher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh saw that the misery of Israel was very bitter, whether bond or free, but there was no helper for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh did not decree to blot out the name of Israel from under the heavens, so he saved them by the hand of Jeroboam the son of Jehoash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the remainder of the acts of Jeroboam, all that he did, his powerful deeds, how he fought, and how he restored Damascus and Hamath of Judah to Israel, are they not written on the scroll of the events of the days of the kings of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jeroboam slept with his ancestors the kings of Israel, and his son Zechariah became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Azariah the son of Amaziah king of Judah began to reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator
